org.opendaylight.controller.samples.simpleforwarding.internal

Class SimpleForwardingImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.samples.simpleforwarding.internal.SimpleForwardingImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IfNewHostNotify, IListenDataPacket, IListenRoutingUpdates, IInventoryListener

    public class SimpleForwardingImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IfNewHostNotify, IListenRoutingUpdates, IInventoryListener, IListenDataPacket
    This class implements basic L3 forwarding within the managed devices. Forwarding is only done within configured subnets.

    The basic flow is that the module listens for new hosts from the HostTracker service and on discovering a new host it first calls preparePerHostRules() to create a set of new rules that must be installed in the network. This is done by repeatedly calling updatePerHostRuleInSW() for each switch in the network. Then it installs those rules using installPerHostRules().

      • receiveDataPacket

        public PacketResult receiveDataPacket(RawPacket inPkt)
        Description copied from interface: IListenDataPacket
        Handler for receiving the packet. The application can signal back to SAL if the packet has been consumed or no. In case of packet consumed SAL will prevent to keep passing to subsequent listener in the serial chain, but for handlers without dependency things will keep going . The packet will received will have the IncomingNodeConnector set to understand where the packet is coming from
        Specified by:
        receiveDataPacket in interface IListenDataPacket
        Parameters:
        inPkt - Packet received
        Returns:
        An indication if the packet should still be processed or we should stop it.
